meanings.sent1: The wind will overblow the leaves in the park.
meanings.sent2: The storm overblew the papers off the table.
meanings.sent3: Don't let the wind overblow your hat away!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter overblew the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The strong gusts overblew the fragile flowers in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The fan can overblow the papers on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The balloon overblew and popped suddenly.
meanings.sent3: The wind overblowed so hard, it knocked over the trash cans.
meanings.sent4: His anger overblew any chance of a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent5: The hurricane overblew the flimsy tent in the camping trip.

meanings.definition: To exaggerate or make too much of.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overblow her achievements in conversations.
meanings.sent2: The news report overblew the impact of the minor incident.
meanings.sent3: His excuse for being late was so overblown, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist overblew the size of the fish in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The politician's promises were overblown and unrealistic.
